WRITING.TEXT: i'm going to say it's a collection of city states each competing for more land. i make a version of this piece at the beginning of every year (without referring to last year's illustration) to see how i've changed -- gay pride has gotten larger and anxiety has lost some territory, for reference :)
you caught me
haha, yeah, there are definitely some moments of darkness and some moments of levity. i was trying to be as honest as i could; it's not all sunshine up there after all!

WRITING.TITLE: I did a watercolor illustration of my mind! :D [OC]

WRITING.TEXT: I haven't used him in the games either actually! I was just very confused / intrigued by the character design so I decided to see if I could add to it. I don't even own the new games yet, but as an illustrator / designer I'm often more interested in how pokemon designs work aesthetically-- Dhelmise really threw me because, as people in the comments section keep mentioning, it doesn't really have any discernible facial features or expressions. That really bothered me when I first saw it, but when I looked up its backstory where it talked about how it's possessed ghost-seaweed, the design grew on me, and now I actually think it's pretty cool. Plus there have been faceless pokemon since gen 1 with Starmie (coincidentally another one of my favorites! haha). I actually often end up prefering the more ambiguous character designs like Dhelmise, Starmie, Aegislash etc. to the more humanoid ones (Pheromosa, Tornadus, etc.) So I guess the reason Dhelmise is one of my favorites from this gen is because he made me ponder the most, if that makes sense :P
pen and watercolor :)
I'm working on more from Sun and Moon, will likely post in a couple days :)
omg
that is the highest compliment i have ever received as an artist

WRITING.TITLE: Playing with cartography by looking at pre-Roman Europe / Middle East! [OC] [2271 X 1635]

WRITING.TEXT: I've pretty fully fleshed out a rather complicated language for a country in my world-- verbs conjugate by the indicative, subjunctive, and deductive moods, present, perfect, imperfect, and pluperfect tenses, active and mediopassive voices, singular, plural, and dual persons, and infinitive, gerund, and supine non-finite verbs, with a total of 75 possible conjugations per verb; nouns decline into 10 cases as well as into singular, dual, and plural numbers; there are two writing systems-- one older, "traditional" one for important and/or sacred texts, and one newer, simplified one for everyday use (much like how modern Hebrew works); the dictionary currently has about 350 words and is growing in number! I don't know how detailed this is for fellow worldbuilders but this is definitely the most in-depth I have gotten :)

I'm good at things in the realm of visual arts (drawing, photography, illustration, glassblowing, graphic design) and in the realm of music (singing, trumpet, piano). I also would like to think that I'm a great mediator. I've been told by one of my housemates that I am the glue that keeps the four of us together. I'm good at expressing my feelings through writing (much better than in person, in fact), and I am good at systematic, detail-oriented subjects such as linguistics and geography. But above everything else the best thing I am at is wasting time. :P

WRITING.TITLE: Me [21/M] and my friend [21/F] are potentially in the midst of a fallout because of a start-up company we're helping to run. I'm depressed and struggling with suicidal thoughts, and she is furious with me for being indirect and rude to her. I don't know what to do so I thought I would come here.
WRITING.TEXT:
My best friend / roommate just lost a great deal of respect for me. We are in the midst of starting a business, for which I am the graphic designer. Since it's a start-up, none of us are getting paid for any of the work that we do, yet I have been spending two-three hours daily working on designs for the company. I put all of my personal art/design projects on hold and my grades have been starting to suffer. She hasn't been the most understanding, using "this is a business, sometimes things aren't fair" as a reason to drastically shorten due dates for big projects last minute and telling clients that I will do free work for them, as well, without my consent. Regardless, I did not feel very respected, and tried to bring this up, but she reacted negatively every time I did. Being terrified of direct conflict, I internalized all of the negativity I had built up, acting very passive aggressively with her and sometimes ignoring her when she would try to talk to me about projects. This went on for a couple of days until I asked to talk with her earlier this evening. I tried to express my issues with her but she (being a very forward extrovert) conveyed the problems she had with me much more easily. She told me that she didn't deserve the way I have been treating her and that it was childish and that I should have been more direct. I recognized all of this and quietly apologized; I also choked and was pretty silent for most of the conversation. In any case, I plan on leaving the company and trying to fix the mess I have made of my academic semester.
The problem is that although we are terrible doing business together, we live together so well and get along amazingly. Before this, we didn't have any problems with one another. It feels really awful to be afraid to talk to the person I consider my best friend, and I hate myself for having hurt her.
I've been dealing with depression for a bit over a year now, and this has definitely triggered a lot for me. I feel like a failure as a friend for not being able to effectively talk about my problems, instead acting extremely rude without explanation. I am very severely shaming myself for having hurt a person that I care about, and I have self-harmed and had suicidal thoughts for the first time in a while. If I am failing my classes, have tarnished my living situation and closest friendship, and can't keep a start-up going for less than half a year, then why am I even bothering anymore?
Thanks for catching that! Still somewhat new to reddit. I updated the post so people should be able to see the link now!

Hi! First off, thank you so much!! I don't really know what I'm doing so I am so relieved that the terrain and rivers make sense for the most part and that the colors are working well. I hand drew everything originally, and then scanned it and colored it with photoshop. It's a very large drawing (3 feet x 6 feet), which I why I don't have a complete scanned/colored world yet.
I haven't heard of Fabled Lands-- I suppose I draw much of my inspiration from Tolkien's works, as well as the coastlines of my native Northern California.
The constellations actually hint at how the inhabitants of this world try to make sense of it. The northern and southern poles are too cold, mountainous, and dark for anyone to explore and no one has really been there, so most people assume that the planet just slopes up into space.
Thank you very, very much for the suggestions, too! I suppose I wanted the Luarm Sea to act as some type of Mediterranean environment but I might experiment with the overall shape and how it relates to Zargoza Bay. I'll definitely do some research and look at older maps. I never really thought of how a native cartographer would refer to places in this world--very useful suggestion.
All in all THANK YOU SO MUCH for the help and encouragement. I'll be sure to put up some updates in the future!
